title: Financials Flat As Traders Hedge On Rate Views — Financials Roundup
text:
Shares of banks and other financial institutions were more or less flat as traders hedged their bets on the outlook for interest rates.

Economically sensitive companies, including financial stocks, initially plunged after a surprisingly weak services-sector survey from the Institute for Supply Management. The Dow Jones Industrial Average dropped more than 300 points at one stage.

The cyclical sectors rebounded, however, as investors bet the weak data would prompt the Federal Reserve to cut interest rates.

Charles Schwab's decision to eliminate trading commissions continued to weigh on discount brokerages. Shares of Charles Schwab and TD Ameritrade, which matched the offer, compounded recent losses while ETrade, which also followed suit, steadied Thursday.

Wall Street investment bank Lazard is cutting up to 7% of its employees in its asset-management unit and closing some investment funds by year's end, The Wall Street Journal reported.

Tokio Marine Holdings, which controls Japan's top insurer of cars, houses and other property, agreed to buy U.S. high-end home-insurance specialist Pure Group in a $3.1 billion deal, as it expands beyond the Japanese market.
